content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player who is comfortable taking risks, I would choose to play strategically rather than randomly. In this game, there's an opportunity for mutual gain when both players pick R (getting 45$ each). However, if I always chose R, my opponent could potentially exploit the situation by choosing B whenever I play R, getting a higher payout in those instances.

On the other hand, if I choose B consistently, my opponent would have an incentive to also pick B most of the time (getting 40$ each round), as it guarantees them a steady income. However, they might still occasionally switch to R to maximize their earnings in that scenario.

To maximize my own potential earnings, I should aim for a mixed strategy where I don't always pick the same option. This could potentially confuse my opponent and make it harder for them to exploit the system. Since this game has 75 rounds, there is an opportunity to recover from any losses over time with a well-timed switch in strategies.

Considering these factors, I would choose R as my first move {R}, but I plan on varying my choices throughout the game based on the opponent's behavior and past moves.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Given that my opponent chose R in the previous round, I will now choose B {B}. This decision is based on a mixed strategy to increase the chances of maximizing my earnings over the long run by confusing my opponent and making it harder for them to exploit the system. In this specific instance, choosing B allows me to earn 35$ in comparison to the 0$ I would have received if both of us had chosen R again.

In this specific instance, choosing R allows me to earn 45$ in comparison to the 35$ I would have received if both of us had chosen R again or if I chose B.

I'll keep varying my choices throughout the game based on the opponent's behavior and past moves to ensure a more unpredictable strategy and maximize my potential earnings over the long run.
